alert.note: Alert for Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 2:23PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Malheur County through 300 PM PDT... At 223 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pelican Point to near Birch Creek Campground. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pelican Point and Diamond Butte around 340 PM MDT. Coffeepot Crater, Slocum Creek Campground and southern Owyhee Reservoir around 350 PM MDT. Leslie Gulch, Cow Lakes, Succor Creek Campground and Mahogany Mountain around 400 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
